pt: {sc}attempt{/sc} {sc}try{/sc} {sc}endeavor{/sc} {sc}essay{/sc} {sc}strive{/sc} mean to make an effort to accomplish an end. {sc}attempt{/sc} stresses the initiation or beginning of an effort.

pt.t: will {it}attempt{/it} to photograph the rare bird

pt: {sc}try{/sc} is often close to {sc}attempt{/sc} but may stress effort or experiment made in the hope of testing or proving something.

pt.t: {it}tried{/it} to determine which was the better procedure

pt: {sc}endeavor{/sc} heightens the implications of exertion and difficulty.

pt.t: {it}endeavored{/it} to find crash survivors in the mountains

pt: {sc}essay{/sc} implies difficulty but also suggests tentative trying or experimenting.

pt.t: will {it}essay{/it} a dramatic role for the first time

pt: {sc}strive{/sc} implies great exertion against great difficulty and specifically suggests persistent effort.

et: Middle English, to quarrel, contend, fight, endeavor, from Anglo-French {it}estriver{/it} to quarrel, from {it}estri, estrif{/it} strife {ma}{mat|strife|}{/ma}
shortdef: to devote serious effort or energy : endeavor
